intro: Spiesia bracteosa, commonly known as the bracteosa spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, featuring simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its most distinctive feature is the presence of bracts, which are modified leaves that often serve as floral structures. Spiesia bracteosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
